Title: Egypt’s EGAS seeks FSRU for Ain Sukhna from 2026 to replace Hoegh Galleon
Description: Egypt’s state-owned EGAS is looking to secure a floating storage regasification unit for installation at its Ain Sukhna LNG receiving terminal from 2026 after the temporary charter for the Hoegh Galleon FSRU ends, according to sources with knowledge of the matter.
Author: CK

Title: “Something more concrete” on possible EU sanctions on Russian LNG expected in June: Simson
Description: The European Commissioner for Energy, Kadri Simson, expects that ongoing talks on a possible ban on transshipments of Russian LNG cargoes at European ports as part of a fourteenth round of sanctions on Russia will yield “something more concrete” in June.
Author: CK
